oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Active vibration control of glass-epoxy composite box beam using output feedback
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: JAIN, S
MANJUNATH, TC
BANDYOPADHYAY, B
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: time-invariant systems
piezoelectric actuators
pole assignment
shape control
design
smart structure
composites
periodic output feedback control
finite element method
state space model
vibration control
timoshenko beam theory lmi
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This paper presents the modeling and design of a Periodic Output Feedback (POF) controller to suppress the vibrations of a smart thin walled composite box beam. Collocated piezoelectric patches are bonded as sensor / actuator to the master structure at a certain finite element location on the beam, i.e., nearby the fixed end of the composite box beam. The beam structure is modelled in state space form using the concept of piezoelectric theory, the Timoshenko beam theory and the Finite Element Method. The beam is subjected to an external disturbance (impulse, sine, random excitations). When the proposed controller is put in the loop with the plant, the plant performs well and the vibrations are damped out in a quicker time. The performance of the proposed controller is thus evaluated for vibration control and the conclusions are drawn.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: 2006 IEEE International Conference on Industrial Technology, Vols 1-6,2330-2335
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: IEEE International Conference on Industrial Technology,Bombay, INDIA,DEC 15-17, 2006
